title: assertSame doesn't give useful output on misordered arrays
body:
Hello,

given the following code:

```
<?php

class DemoSameArray extends PHPUnit_Framework_TestCase
{
    public function testOkay()
    {
        $this->assertSame(array(
            "a" => "a",
            "b" => "b",
            "c" => "c"
        ),array(
            "a" => "a",
            "b" => "b",
            "c" => "c"
        ));
    }

    public function testWrong()
    {
        $this->assertSame(array(
            "a" => "a",
            "c" => "c"
        ),array(
            "a" => "a",
            "b" => "b",
            "c" => "c"
        ));
    }

    public function testMisordered()
    {
        $this->assertSame(array(
            "a" => "a",
            "c" => "c",
            "b" => "b"
        ),array(
            "a" => "a",
            "b" => "b",
            "c" => "c"
        ));
    }
}
?>
```

The call

```
phpunit DemoSameArray.php
```

doesn't give entirely helpful output with PHPUnit 3.5.5 for the 'Misordered' case:

```
There were 2 failures:

1) DemoSameArray::testWrong
--- Expected
+++ Actual
@@ @@
 Array
 (
     [a] => a
+    [b] => b
     [c] => c
 )

/opt/ovi/nad/cmdb/moo/DemoSameArray.php:27

2) DemoSameArray::testMisordered
--- Expected
+++ Actual
@@ @@
 Array
 (
     [a] => a
     [b] => b
     [c] => c
 )
```

... output like the one in the 'Wrong' case would be more helpful, i.e. something like:

```
--- Expected
+++ Actual
@@ @@
 Array
 (
     [a] => a
-    [c] => c
     [b] => b
+    [c] => c
 )
```

Cheers,

   Andreas
